commit_message:
Add support for blockdiag to docs

Add support for the blockdiag family of diagrams [1]:
blockdiag, actdiag, seqdiag, and nwdiag.

These enable block, sequence, activity and logical network
diagrams, defined in simple text format that
can be easily embedded in our manila docs.  For examples,
see [2].

[1] http://blockdiag.com
[2] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/juno-incubator/example.html

Change-Id: Ic7782ea0642f7a5912f397376948b45ac134604d

commit_message:
Create indexes for foreign keys

Some database backends (for example PostgreSQL) do not automatically
create an index on a ForeignKey. As a results database queries are slow.
Adding the missing indexes and a migration that will only add indexes if
they were not already there.

Change-Id: If2ccc0d4066afb6095be460fa36068c9bd486cb0
Co-Authored-By: Mate Lakat <mlakat@suse.com>
Closes-bug: #1666547

commit_message:
update method to manila-network-ovs

The method 'ovs_add_port' from interface.py should be called from
ovs_lib.py analogous to the 'ovs_lib.OVSBridge.delete_port'. So, I
do some changes in a consistent style.

Change-Id: I48577339cc49715aa9db8a97bc11e008344d773a

commit_message:
[Dell EMC Unity] Create with user capacity

The unity driver is creating the file system with allocated capacity
which caused the usable space is less then the size specified by user.
This patch changed the driver to create file system with user capacity.

Besides, change the version to 3.0.0 for Pike release.

Closes-Bug: 1674882
Change-Id: I2acf294d45662fd91a153fcd1f76202c3ad10132
(cherry picked from commit f07e09cbb8ad65b40a058d07c52d9257100b1315)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/86/452386/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Dell EMC Unity driver is changed to create shares with the available space instead of allocated space as the same as the size specified by user. - Dell EMC Unity driver version is changed to 3.0.0 for Pike release.

commit_message:
Replacing six.iteritems() with .items()

We should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3* as well. And dict.items/keys will be more readable.

Change-Id: I98c214d4e3a4363b72a55b73d93111dcfda8f4ed

commit_message:
Added cyborg fpga programming spec

Change-Id: I261bee93a966d73cf489c85006d316179bc0ca45
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cyborg refs/changes/95/559395/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================================== Cyborg FPGA Programming Service Proposal ==================================================== Blueprint url is not available yet https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-cyborg/+spec/cyborg-fpga-programming-ability This spec proposed a Programming Service to be added to Cyborg to allow user dynamically change the functions loaded on FPGA in cloud environment Problem description =================== A field-programmable gate array (FPGA) is an integrated circuit designed to be configured by a customer or a designer after manufacturing. Their advantage lies in that they are sometimes significantly faster for some applications because of their parallel nature and optimality in terms of the number of gates used for a certain process. In addition, FPGA can be reprogrammed based on different applications Hence, using FPGA for application acceleration in cloud has been becoming desirable. Cyborg as a management framwork for heterogeneous accelerators, tracking, deploying and reprogramming FPGAs are much needed features. Since the FPGA modelling has already been proposed in another document. This one will be focused on proposing Reporgramming Service for FPGAs in Cyborg Use Cases --------- In the scenario of OpenCL, user loads the accelerators on FPGA for their application. When different applications are executing on OCL environment, the accelerators will be changed from time to time. It will not be feasible to power down the entire host and change the hardware manually by lab admin. In stead, through the reprogramming service, admin can manage the functions of FPGA using a set of REST APIs. Similarly, during the maintenance of FPGA, admin needs to update/migrate shells and bitstreams on FPGAs within data center. Cyborg Reprogramming Service will allow them to use the APIs from a centralized console. Proposed change =============== First of all, Cyborg needs to add extra REST APIs to allow others to invok the programming service. The REST api should have following format:: Url: {base_url}/fpga/{fpga_uuid} Method: GET URL Params: None Data Params: glance_bitstream_uuid Success Response: PUT: Code: 200 Content: { "msg" : "bitstream has been loaded successfully"} Error Response Code: 401 UNAUTHORIZED Content: { error : "Log in" } OR Code: 422 Unprocessable Entry Content: { error : "User is not authorized to use the resource" } Sample Call: To program fpga resource with fpga_uuid=2864a139-c2cd-4f9f-abf3-44eb3f09b83c with bitstream with uuid=0b955a5b-f5dd-49d0-8c4f-28729427d303 $.ajax({ url: "/fpga/2864a139-c2cd-4f9f-abf3-44eb3f09b83c", data: { "glance_bitstream_uuid": "0b955a5b-f5dd-49d0-8c4f-28729427d303" }, dataType: "json", type : "put", success : function(r) { console.log(r); } }); Second, implement the service in Cyborg which does three tasks: 1. identify the host location of the requested FPGA/Partial Reconfiguraion(PR) Region(e.g. on which host is the board located). 2. Check if the user(API caller) has the privilige to use the given bitstream and host. 3. If the previous check passed, Cyborg sends the program notification to the target host with requested FPGA. Third, implement notification callee in Cyborg Agent. This should be a rpc call with following signiture:: int program_fpga_with_bitstream(fpga_uuid, bitstream_uuid) The function takes both fpga_uuid and bitstream_uuid as input. It uses fpga_uuid to identify which specific FPGA/PR region is going to be programmed and uses bitstream_uuid to retrieve bitstream from the bitstream storage service(Glance in the context of OpenStack). In addition, this is a synchronous meaning it will wait for the programming task to be completed and then return a status code as integer. The return code should have following interpretation:: ==================================================================== | code | meaning | ==================================================================== | 0 | program successfully | | 1 | failed with unkown errors | | 2 | invalid fpga_uuid(target fpga not found) | | 3 | invalid bitstream_uuid(bitstream can not be downloaded) | ==================================================================== Alternatives ------------ Data model impact ----------------- REST API impact --------------- A rest api will be added to the Cyborg service as we discussed previously. It should not impact any of the existing rest apis Security impact --------------- The access to FPGA/PR region and bitstreams should be carefully checked. Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- On the Cyborg Agent side, it relies on program() api implemented by vendor. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Li Liu <liliu1@huawei.com> Work Items ---------- * Implement the cyborg program service rest api * Implement the cyborg program service * Implement the notification callee in Cyborg Agent, which invokes vendor driver Dependencies ============ Testing ======= Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1

commit_message:
Add Infortrend Manila Driver

This driver supports NFS and CIFS shares.

The following operations are supported:
 - Create a share.
 - Delete a share.
 - Allow share access.
 - Deny share access.
 - Manage a share.
 - Unmanage a share.
 - Extend a share.
 - Shrink a share.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint infortrend-manila-driver

Change-Id: Iea6b0c06439f79f2a63605cc44102127cd221235
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/46/465846/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2017 Infortrend Technology, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log from manila import exception from manila.i18n import _ from manila.share import driver from manila.share.drivers.infortrend import infortrend_nas LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) infortrend_nas_opts = [ cfg.StrOpt('infortrend_nas_ip', default=None, help='Infortrend nas ip. ' 'It is the ip for management.'), cfg.StrOpt('infortrend_nas_user', default='manila', help='Infortrend nas username.'), cfg.StrOpt('infortrend_nas_password', default=None, help='Infortrend nas password. ' 'This is not necessary ' 'if infortrend_nas_ssh_key is set.'), cfg.StrOpt('infortrend_nas_ssh_key', default=None, help='Infortrend nas ssh key. ' 'This is not necessary ' 'if infortrend_nas_password is set.'), cfg.StrOpt('infortrend_share_pools', default=None, help='Infortrend nas pool name list. ' 'It is separated with comma.'), cfg.StrOpt('infortrend_share_channels', default=None, help='Infortrend channels for file service. ' 'It is separated with comma.'), cfg.IntOpt('infortrend_cli_max_retries', default=5, help='Maximum retry times for cli.'), cfg.IntOpt('infortrend_cli_timeout', default=30, help='CLI timeout in seconds.'), ] CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.register_opts(infortrend_nas_opts) class InfortrendNASDriver(driver.ShareDriver): """Infortrend Share Driver for GS/GSe Family using NASCLI. Version history: 1.0.0 - Initial driver """ VERSION = "1.0.0" PROTOCOL = "NFS_CIFS" def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): super(InfortrendNASDriver, self).__init__(False, *args, **kwargs) self.configuration.append_config_values(infortrend_nas_opts) nas_ip = self.configuration.safe_get('infortrend_nas_ip') username = self.configuration.safe_get('infortrend_nas_user') password = self.configuration.safe_get('infortrend_nas_password') ssh_key = self.configuration.safe_get('infortrend_nas_ssh_key') retries = self.configuration.safe_get('infortrend_cli_max_retries') timeout = self.configuration.safe_get('infortrend_cli_timeout') self.backend_name = self.configuration.safe_get('share_backend_name') if not nas_ip: msg = _('The infortrend_nas_ip is not set.') raise exception.InvalidParameterValue(err=msg) if not (password or ssh_key): msg = _('Either infortrend_nas_password or infortrend_nas_ssh_key ' 'should be set.') raise exception.InvalidParameterValue(err=msg) pool_dict = self._init_pool_dict() channel_dict = self._init_channel_dict() self.ift_nas = infortrend_nas.InfortrendNAS(nas_ip, username, password, ssh_key, retries, timeout, pool_dict, channel_dict) def _init_pool_dict(self): temp_pool_dict = {} pools_name = self.configuration.safe_get('infortrend_share_pools') if not pools_name: msg = _('The infortrend_share_pools is not set.') raise exception.InvalidParameterValue(err=msg) tmp_pool_list = pools_name.split(',') for pool in tmp_pool_list: temp_pool_dict[pool.strip()] = {} return temp_pool_dict def _init_channel_dict(self): temp_ch_dict = {} channels = self.configuration.safe_get('infortrend_share_channels') if not channels: msg = _('The infortrend_share_channels is not set.') raise exception.InvalidParameterValue(err=msg) tmp_ch_list = channels.split(',') for channel in tmp_ch_list: temp_ch_dict[channel.strip()] = '' return temp_ch_dict def do_setup(self, context): """Any initialization the share driver does while starting.""" LOG.debug('Infortrend NAS do_setup start.') self.ift_nas.do_setup() def check_for_setup_error(self): """Check for setup error.""" LOG.debug('Infortrend NAS check_for_setup_error start.') self.ift_nas.check_for_setup_error() def _update_share_stats(self): """Retrieve stats info from share group.""" LOG.debug('Updating Infortrend share stats.') data = dict(share_backend_name=self.backend_name, vendor_name='Infortrend', driver_version=self.VERSION, storage_protocol=self.PROTOCOL, total_capacity_gb=0.0, free_capacity_gb=0.0, reserved_percentage=0, pools=self.ift_nas.update_pools_stats()) LOG.debug('Infortrend pools status: %s' % data['pools']) super(InfortrendNASDriver, self)._update_share_stats(data) def update_access(self, context, share, access_rules, add_rules, delete_rules, share_server=None): """Update access rules for given share. :param context: Current context :param share: Share model with share data. :param access_rules: All access rules for given share :param add_rules: Empty List or List of access rules which should be added. access_rules already contains these rules. :param delete_rules: Empty List or List of access rules which should be removed. access_rules doesn't contain these rules. :param share_server: Not used by this driver. :returns: None, or a dictionary of ``access_id``, ``access_key`` as key: value pairs for the rules added, where, ``access_id`` is the UUID (string) of the access rule, and ``access_key`` is the credential (string) of the entity granted access. During recovery after error, the returned dictionary must contain ``access_id``, ``access_key`` for all the rules that the driver is ordered to resync, i.e. rules in the ``access_rules`` parameter. """ LOG.debug( 'Update access rules for share: %(share)s, ' 'access_rules: %(access_rules)s, ' 'add_rules: %(add_rules)s, ' 'delete_rules: %(delete_rules)s', { 'share': dict(share), 'access_rules': self._list_of_dict(access_rules), 'add_rules': self._list_of_dict(add_rules), 'delete_rules': self._list_of_dict(delete_rules), }) return self.ift_nas.update_access(share, access_rules, add_rules, delete_rules, share_server) def _list_of_dict(self, list_of_dict): temp_list = [] for data in list_of_dict: temp_dict = dict(data) temp_list.append(temp_dict) return temp_list def create_share(self, context, share, share_server=None): """Is called to create share.""" LOG.debug('Creating share: %s.' % dict(share)) return self.ift_nas.create_share(share, share_server) def delete_share(self, context, share, share_server=None): """Is called to remove share.""" LOG.debug('Deleting share: %s.' % dict(share)) return self.ift_nas.delete_share(share, share_server) def get_pool(self, share): """Return pool name where the share resides on. :param share: The share hosted by the driver. """ return self.ift_nas.get_pool(share) def ensure_share(self, context, share, share_server=None): """Invoked to ensure that share is exported. Driver can use this method to update the list of export locations of the share if it changes. To do that, you should return list with export locations. :return None or list with export locations """ return self.ift_nas.ensure_share(share, share_server) def allow_access(self, context, share, access, share_server=None): """Allow access to the share.""" return self.ift_nas.allow_access(share, access, share_server) def deny_access(self, context, share, access, share_server=None): """Deny access to the share.""" return self.ift_nas.deny_access(share, access, share_server) def manage_existing(self, share, driver_options): """Brings an existing share under Manila management. If the provided share is not valid, then raise a ManageInvalidShare exception, specifying a reason for the failure. If the provided share is not in a state that can be managed, such as being replicated on the backend, the driver *MUST* raise ManageInvalidShare exception with an appropriate message. The share has a share_type, and the driver can inspect that and compare against the properties of the referenced backend share. If they are incompatible, raise a ManageExistingShareTypeMismatch, specifying a reason for the failure. :param share: Share model :param driver_options: Driver-specific options provided by admin. :return: share_update dictionary with required key 'size', which should contain size of the share. """ LOG.debug( 'Manage existing for share: %(share)s, ' 'driver_options: %(driver_options)s, ', { 'share': dict(share), 'driver_options': dict(driver_options), }) return self.ift_nas.manage_existing(share, driver_options) def unmanage(self, share): """Removes the specified share from Manila management. Does not delete the underlying backend share. For most drivers, this will not need to do anything. However, some drivers might use this call as an opportunity to clean up any Manila-specific configuration that they have associated with the backend share. If provided share cannot be unmanaged, then raise an UnmanageInvalidShare exception, specifying a reason for the failure. """ LOG.debug( 'Unmanage share: %(share)s', { 'share': dict(share), }) return self.ift_nas.unmanage(share) def extend_share(self, share, new_size, share_server=None): """Extends size of existing share. :param share: Share model :param new_size: New size of share (new_size > share['size']) :param share_server: Optional -- Share server model """ return self.ift_nas.extend_share(share, new_size, share_server) def shrink_share(self, share, new_size, share_server=None): """Shrinks size of existing share. If consumed space on share larger than new_size driver should raise ShareShrinkingPossibleDataLoss exception: raise ShareShrinkingPossibleDataLoss(share_id=share['id']) :param share: Share model :param new_size: New size of share (new_size < share['size']) :param share_server: Optional -- Share server model :raises ShareShrinkingPossibleDataLoss, NotImplementedError """ return self.ift_nas.shrink_share(share, new_size, share_server)

commit_message:
CI: Update tempest commit

Manila pins the version of tempest it tests on the gate.
This is antithetical to the tempest plugin mechanism. So,
our gate breaks when some plugin relies on code from tempest
that is not part of the commit manila pins in the CI.

While we are working towards a permanent fix to this problem,
let's update our pin as a workaround.

Closes-Bug: #1693832

Change-Id: Ide131229efdea5a48dc389449602f2b0abb699f7
(cherry picked from commit 76e569a6167c5648864e9cdbf006e274616a8e17)

commit_message:
Add RBAC tests for identity v3 application credentials API

This patchset adds RBAC tests for identity v3 application
credentials API [0], which enforces the following policies: [1].

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/index.html#application-credentials
[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/common/policies/application_credential.py

Change-Id: I986e245a0bf7c4c37089a4a2dae7d9067c74162b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/83/571383/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2018 AT&T Corporation. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest import config from tempest.lib.common.utils import data_utils from tempest.lib.common.utils import test_utils from tempest.lib import decorators from patrole_tempest_plugin import rbac_rule_validation from patrole_tempest_plugin.tests.api.identity import rbac_base CONF = config.CONF class ApplicationCredentialsV3RbacTest(rbac_base.BaseIdentityV3RbacTest): @classmethod def skip_checks(cls): super(ApplicationCredentialsV3RbacTest, cls).skip_checks() if not CONF.identity_feature_enabled.application_credentials: raise cls.skipException("Application credentials are not available" " in this environment") @classmethod def resource_setup(cls): super(ApplicationCredentialsV3RbacTest, cls).resource_setup() cls.user_id = cls.os_primary.credentials.user_id cls.project_id = cls.os_primary.credentials.project_id def _create_application_credential(self, name=None, **kwargs): name = name or data_utils.rand_name('application_credential') application_credential = ( self.application_credentials_client.create_application_credential( self.user_id, name=name, **kwargs))['application_credential'] self.addCleanup( test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc, self.application_credentials_client.delete_application_credential, self.user_id, application_credential['id']) return application_credential @decorators.idempotent_id('b53bee14-e9df-4929-b257-6def76c12e4d') @rbac_rule_validation.action(service="keystone", rule="identity:create_application_credential") def test_create_application_credential(self): with self.rbac_utils.override_role(self): self._create_application_credential() @decorators.idempotent_id('58b3c3a0-5ad0-44f7-8da7-0736f71f7168') @rbac_rule_validation.action(service="keystone", rule="identity:list_application_credentials") def test_list_application_credentials(self): with self.rbac_utils.override_role(self): self.application_credentials_client.list_application_credentials( user_id=self.user_id) @decorators.idempotent_id('d7b13968-a8a6-47fd-8e1d-7cc7f565c7f8') @rbac_rule_validation.action(service="keystone", rule="identity:get_application_credential") def test_show_application_credential(self): app_cred = self._create_application_credential() with self.rbac_utils.override_role(self): self.application_credentials_client.show_application_credential( user_id=self.user_id, application_credential_id=app_cred['id']) @decorators.idempotent_id('521b7c0f-1dd5-47a6-ae95-95c0323d7735') @rbac_rule_validation.action(service="keystone", rule="identity:delete_application_credential") def test_delete_application_credential(self): app_cred = self._create_application_credential() with self.rbac_utils.override_role(self): self.application_credentials_client.delete_application_credential( user_id=self.user_id, application_credential_id=app_cred['id'])

commit_message:
Fix: Add provider physnet and network_type to manila

When create manila share, there will create a manila network
with the name 'manila_service_network' which is from manila.conf,
but we not assign a physnet and network_type. There will catch a
error when we have multi provider networks in ml2 (e.g physnet3)
for some reason. So, we need add some options in manila.conf.

Closes-Bug: #1696377
Change-Id: I22c739a8d31098e537c7ed260121dc45da7a4284

commit_message:
Add Compression capability support to Spectrum Scale Driver

Spectrum Scale internally uses placement policies to compress
the share. This policy will work only once at time of creation
of share so we are using crontab to compress shares on regular
basis. Triggering the compression policy is configurable.
With this change we are exposing the compression feature of
Spectrum Scale via manila to compress the share.

Implements: blueprint spectrum-scale-compression-support

Change-Id: I79bf9792b787379775b6783043e6f8dbe3c7b4ea

Change-Id: I5e9f507db5ff73f0194819c0023a2c5ef29cfd5f

added_lines: class SharesCephFSTest(base.BaseSharesTest): @classmethod def resource_setup(cls): super(SharesCephFSTest, cls).resource_setup() if cls.protocol not in CONF.share.enable_protocols: message = "%s tests are disabled" % cls.protocol raise cls.skipException(message) cls.share = cls.create_share(cls.protocol) @tc.attr(base.TAG_POSITIVE, base.TAG_BACKEND) def test_create_get_delete_share(self): share = self.create_share(self.protocol) detailed_elements = {'name', 'id', 'availability_zone', 'description', 'project_id', 'created_at', 'share_proto', 'metadata', 'size', 'snapshot_id', 'share_network_id', 'status', 'share_type', 'volume_type', 'links', 'is_public'} msg = ( "At least one expected element missing from share " "response. Expected %(expected)s, got %(actual)s." % { "expected": detailed_elements, "actual": share.keys(), } ) self.assertTrue(detailed_elements.issubset(share.keys()), msg) self.assertFalse(share['is_public'])

commit_message:
Fix tempest tests for pre-existing share networks

There was a valid concern raised over the
change #491841 after it was merged.
This patch addresses that concern.

Change-Id: I78eaae18948e56bfbc919ed7e84779930b42b495

commit_message:
Generic driver - mounting volumes via UUID

Share volumes mounted to the service instance should be mounted
via its uuid (/dev/disk/by-uuid/...) instead of canonical
paths (/dev/vdb) to prevent messing up the shares after restarts.

Change-Id: Id53dee5ca756a1a6f2453c1fd580f3309a0988c0
Closes-Bug: 1713024
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/82/506682/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _swap_canonical_paths_for_uuid(self, server_details): import re regex = r"^\/dev\/[s,v]d[a-z]{1,2}\s" def get_canonical_paths(inpt): r = re.match(regex, inpt) if r: return r.group(0) fstab, __ = self._ssh_exec(server_details, ["cat", "/etc/fstab"]) canonicals = filter(None, map(get_canonical_paths, fstab.splitlines())) def _get_canonicals_uuid(canonical_path): uuid, __ = self._ssh_exec(server_details, ['sudo', 'blkid', '-s', 'UUID', '-o', 'value', canonical_path]) return uuid.strip() for canonical in canonicals: try: uuid = _get_canonicals_uuid(canonical) if uuid: self._ssh_exec( server_details, ["sudo", "sed", "-i", "'s,'\"%s\",\"/dev/disk/by-uuid/%s\",'g'" % (canonical, uuid), "/etc/fstab"]) except exception.ProcessExecutionError as e: LOG.error( "Failed to decanonicalize disk '%s' on instance '%s'.", canonical, server_details['instance_id']) raise exception.ShareBackendException(msg=six.text_type(e)) self._swap_canonical_paths_for_uuid(server_details) except exception.ProcessExecutionError as e: LOG.error("Failed to swap canonical for uuid paths on server '%s'", server_details['instance_id']) raise exception.ShareBackendException(msg=six.text_type(e)) try:

subject: Use constants for microversion values
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-03 11:33:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/11500b61138ebae50c86921eb613fe7d9aa42be6', 'message': "WIP: Use constants for microversion values

We very often end up with merge conflicts for any patches that increment
microversions due to conflicting numbers. We can't really solve that,
but we can avoid the need to update version numbers throughout the code
by defining a constant value in one place and using that variable
instead.

Based on cinder change [1].

TBD: many tests need to be converted

commit_message:
Use constants for microversion values

We very often end up with merge conflicts for any patches that increment
microversions due to conflicting numbers. We can't really solve that,
but we can avoid the need to update version numbers throughout the code
by defining a constant value in one place and using that variable
instead.

Based on cinder change [1].

[1] Ib3a80fee6caaabb49af097aa197f550c65d94985

Change-Id: I375e319a887812ce1390630d2ba8f58e18c41c77

commit_message:
Replace assertDictMatch with assertDictEqual
assertDictMatch was introduced for Python 2.6 only.
Python 2.7+ contains assertDictEqual.
Closes-Bug: #1646433

Change-Id: Id9593496cc4a29f65cde83084910bcb29cbd5e01

commit_message:
Huawei driver refactor

Huawei driver code currently has many redundant logic and has much
potentiality to improve.
This patch does some refactor, to make the Huawei driver code much
more clear, reliable and maintainable.

Change-Id: I7de4ffb8f84a6003af7caf911d44aa62be401935
TODO: UT refactor work is under way.
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/85/514185/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 Huawei Technologies Co., Ltd. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_log import log from manila import exception from manila.i18n import _ from manila.share.drivers.huawei import huawei_utils LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) class HyperMetroManager(object): def __init__(self, loc_helper, rmt_helper, configuration): self.loc_helper = loc_helper self.rmt_helper = rmt_helper self.configuration = configuration self.vstore_pair = None @property def loc_vstore_id(self): if not self.vstore_pair: self.vstore_pair = self.loc_helper.get_vstore_pair( self.configuration.hypermetro['vstore_pair']) return self.vstore_pair['LOCALVSTOREID'] def create(self, loc_fs_id, loc_pool_name, fs_params): pool_map = self.configuration.hypermetro['hypermetro_pool_map'] if loc_pool_name not in pool_map: msg = _("No hypermetro pool exists for src pool %s." ) % loc_pool_name LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadConfigurationException(reason=msg) pool_info = self.rmt_helper.get_pool_by_name(pool_map[loc_pool_name]) if not pool_info: msg = _("Hypermetro pool %s not exist.") % pool_map[loc_pool_name] LOG.error(msg) raise exception.BadConfigurationException(reason=msg) fs_params["PARENTID"] = pool_info['ID'] fs_params['vstoreId'] = self.vstore_pair['REMOTEVSTOREID'] rmt_fs_id = self.rmt_helper.create_filesystem(fs_params) huawei_utils.wait_fs_online( self.rmt_helper, rmt_fs_id, self.configuration.wait_interval, self.configuration.timeout) metro_params = { "VSTOREPAIRID": self.vstore_pair['ID'], "HCRESOURCETYPE": '2', "LOCALOBJID": loc_fs_id, "REMOTEOBJID": rmt_fs_id, "SPEED": '2', } try: hypermetro_id = self.loc_helper.create_hypermetro(metro_params) except Exception: LOG.exception('Create hypermetro pair failed.') self.rmt_helper.delete_filesystem(rmt_fs_id) raise self.loc_helper.sync_hypermetro(hypermetro_id) return hypermetro_id def delete(self, hypermetro_id): hypermetro = self.loc_helper.get_hypermetro(hypermetro_id) self.loc_helper.disable_hypermetro(hypermetro_id) self.loc_helper.delete_hypermetro(hypermetro_id) self.rmt_helper.delete_filesystem(hypermetro['REMOTEOBJID']) def change_hypermetro_fs_size(self, hypermetro_id, new_size): hypermetro = self.loc_helper.get_hypermetro(hypermetro_id) self.rmt_helper.update_filesystem( hypermetro['REMOTEOBJID'], {"CAPACITY": new_size})

commit_message:
Remove v2 nova/neutron/cinder client options

Keystone v2 options for the nova, neutron, and cinder clients
used by manila were deprecated in mitaka [1] for removal in
a later release.

Remove these for Queens.

[1] Ic211a11308a3295409467efd88bff413482ee58d

Implements BP remove-v2-client-options

Change-Id: Ifece3c204533977f296a85f92735e189dd4c860c

commit_message:
Fix nits in nested provider allocation candidates

Addresses the following minor/nonblocking review comments from earlier
in this series:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567113/14/nova/api/openstack/placement/objects/resource_provider.py@3252
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567113/14/nova/api/openstack/placement/objects/resource_provider.py@3571

Change-Id: Icef450d7da97bb21f5e5e00a2362702d53bcd0c7
Blueprint: nested-resource-providers-allocation-candidates
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/73/572673/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # provs_with_inv is a list of three-tuples with the second element being # the root provider ID and the third being resource class ID. Get the list # of root provider IDs and get all trees that collectively have all # required traits. provs_with_inv |= set((p[0], p[1], rc_id) for p in rc_provs_with_inv) use_same_provider=False. In this scenario, we are able to use multiple providers within the same provider tree to satisfy different resources involved in a single request group.
deleted_lines: # provs_with_inv is a list of two-tuples with the second element being the # root provider ID. Get the list of root provider IDs and get all trees # that collectively have all required traits rc_provs_with_inv = set((p[0], p[1], rc_id) for p in rc_provs_with_inv) provs_with_inv |= rc_provs_with_inv use_same_provider=False. In this scenario, we determine requests across multiple providers being aware of nested resource provider trees.

commit_message:
Switch lxc-dnsmasq to start before lxc

The current state of lxc-dnsmasq starts it after the network
subsystem is started (but not necessarily up) and it could
possibly start after lxc.  This changes things to reflect how
lxc-net upstream systemd file sets up dependencies[1].

[1]: https://github.com/lxc/lxc/blob/master/config/init/systemd/lxc-net.service.in

Change-Id: If378446333dd09e378b3acd297c58fd59ce04789
(cherry picked from commit c5a8965557da2f6d949b8bda28eca0785a7d2c3a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts refs/changes/58/573958/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: After=network-online.target Before=lxc.service

commit_message:
Remove deprecated ip floating commands

We had already implemented floating ip(pool) commands more
than two cycles, we can remove those deprecated commands.

Change-Id: Ib98a7403a63bb0c48c03de4c79795737de2aa84c

deleted_lines: =========== ip floating =========== Compute v2, Network v2 ip floating add --------------- Add floating IP address to server (Deprecated, please use ``server add floating ip`` instead) .. program:: ip floating add .. code:: bash openstack ip floating add <ip-address> <server> .. describe:: <ip-address> IP address to add to server (name only) .. describe:: <server> Server to receive the IP address (name or ID) ip floating create ------------------ Create new floating IP address (Deprecated, please use ``floating ip create`` instead) .. program:: ip floating create .. code:: bash openstack ip floating create [--subnet <subnet>] [--port <port>] [--floating-ip-address <floating-ip-address>] [--fixed-ip-address <fixed-ip-address>] <network> .. option:: --subnet <subnet> Subnet on which you want to create the floating IP (name or ID) (Network v2 only) .. option:: --port <port> Port to be associated with the floating IP (name or ID) (Network v2 only) .. option:: --floating-ip-address <floating-ip-address> Floating IP address (Network v2 only) .. option:: --fixed-ip-address <fixed-ip-address> Fixed IP address mapped to the floating IP (Network v2 only) .. describe:: <network> Network to allocate floating IP from (name or ID) ip floating delete ------------------ Delete floating IP(s) (Deprecated, please use ``floating ip delete`` instead) .. program:: ip floating delete .. code:: bash openstack ip floating delete <floating-ip> [<floating-ip> ...] .. describe:: <floating-ip> Floating IP(s) to delete (IP address or ID) ip floating list ---------------- List floating IP addresses (Deprecated, please use ``floating ip list`` instead) .. program:: ip floating list .. code:: bash openstack ip floating list ip floating remove ------------------ Remove floating IP address from server (Deprecated, please use ``server remove floating ip`` instead) .. program:: ip floating remove .. code:: bash openstack ip floating remove <ip-address> <server> .. describe:: <ip-address> IP address to remove from server (name only) .. describe:: <server> Server to remove the IP address from (name or ID) ip floating show ---------------- Display floating IP details (Deprecated, please use ``floating ip show`` instead) .. program:: ip floating show .. code:: bash openstack ip floating show <floating-ip> .. describe:: <floating-ip> Floating IP to display (IP address or ID)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-07 14:49:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server/commit/aa48bec6affb1cf38507c62881d4f03467157bc2', 'message': 'Update the version of erlang to support rabbitmq

commit_message:
Update the version of erlang to support rabbitmq

The version of erlang we're using, while functional, is not recommended.
This change updates our version of erlang for rabbitmq to be the
recommended version by changing the pinned version of erlang.

The apt package pinning meta dependency has been removed and put into
the apt task file as an include role. To ensure a more uniform process
for setting the version of erlang used with rabbitmq the new variable
`rabbitmq_erlang_version_spec` has been added. This option has a default
of "null" and is set by distro specific variables when applicable.

Erlang version support matrix: https://www.rabbitmq.com/which-erlang.html

Change-Id: Iced12d4533eec068bd11d8bd235d81308ef40427
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 372ccd1bbdbe63ad35a200afab55bb91c4c016da)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server refs/changes/84/573284/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: dependencies: []
deleted_lines: dependencies: - role: apt_package_pinning apt_package_pinning_file_name: "rabbitmq.pref" apt_package_pinning_priority: 999 apt_pinned_packages: - package: "*" release: "Erlang Solutions Ltd." - package: "erlang*" version: "1:19.3*" priority: 1000 when: - ansible_pkg_mgr == 'apt'

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Configure plugins and policies after RabbitMQ""

Now that the actual root cause of the bug has been figured out,
we can revert this revert as this patch had nothing to do with the
problem.

This reverts commit d44eb3b39a4262995d8f551cf88fe81424460ab1.

Change-Id: I41665f57304b03b2a06c2b19c366cffcaf485693
Related-Bug: 1765438

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-09 17:10:26.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/whereto/commit/10915180923fba2e85a7cbe223f3baa1be2a1cc4', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that

Change-Id: If16e79070324776e14279ec0ab12cbebb6a04a5b
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: If16e79070324776e14279ec0ab12cbebb6a04a5b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/whereto refs/changes/34/574034/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
Switch lxc-dnsmasq to start before lxc

The current state of lxc-dnsmasq starts it after the network
subsystem is started (but not necessarily up) and it could
possibly start after lxc.  This changes things to reflect how
lxc-net upstream systemd file sets up dependencies[1].

[1]: https://github.com/lxc/lxc/blob/master/config/init/systemd/lxc-net.service.in

Change-Id: If378446333dd09e378b3acd297c58fd59ce04789
(cherry picked from commit c5a8965557da2f6d949b8bda28eca0785a7d2c3a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts refs/changes/57/573957/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: After=network-online.target Before=lxc.service

unable to start in subnode. In order to fix it, this patch changes
the following URLs:
* advertise-client-urls: List of this member's client URLs to
  advertise to the rest of the cluster. These URLs can contain domain
  names [1]. Example: "http://example.com:2379, http://10.0.0.1:2379"
* listen-client-urls: List of URLs to listen on for client traffic.
  This flag tells the etcd to accept incoming requests from the clients

should be a more reasonable choice.

[2] https://coreos.com/etcd/docs/latest/v2/configuration.html

commit_message:
Fix etcd advertise and listen client URLs

Theses URLs are currently set to SERVICE_HOST, which makes etcd
unable to start in subnode. In order to fix it, this patch changes
the following URLs:
* advertise-client-urls: List of this member's client URLs to
  advertise to the rest of the cluster. These URLs can contain domain
  names [1]. Example: "http://example.com:2379, http://10.0.0.1:2379"
* listen-client-urls: List of URLs to listen on for client traffic.
  This flag tells the etcd to accept incoming requests from the clients
  on the specified scheme://IP:port combinations. Scheme can be either
  http or https. If 0.0.0.0 is specified as the IP, etcd listens to
  the given port on all interfaces. If an IP address is given as well
  as a port, etcd will listen on the given port and interface. Multiple
  URLs may be used to specify a number of addresses and ports to
  listen on. The etcd will respond to requests from any of the listed
  addresses and ports [2].

In before, these two URLs were set by using SERVICE_HOST, which
seems incorrect, because SERVICE_HOST is not necessary the IP address
of current host. However, etcd have to advertise or listen to
an IP address/domain of current host. Use HOST_IP for these URLs
should be a more reasonable choice.

[1] https://coreos.com/etcd/docs/latest/v2/configuration.html
    #advertise-client-urls
[2] https://coreos.com/etcd/docs/latest/v2/configuration.html
    #listen-client-urls

Change-Id: I27b29349d8d55c588f88461ac3658fd1b1342a1f
Closes-Bug: #1720240
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/92/511092/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cmd+=" --advertise-client-urls http://$HOST_IP:$ETCD_PORT" cmd+=" --listen-client-urls http://$HOST_IP:$ETCD_PORT"

commit_message:
Don't install and start etcd3 in subnode

If subnodes wants to use etcd service, they should access the etcd
installed in SERVICE_HOST.

Change-Id: I311cecc542cbfa86a57fa0609736a3322c038c55
Related-Bug: #1720240

commit_message:
Fix update/upgrade or config change for ODL

OpenDaylight creates multiple files the first time it boots, which we do
not mount to the host. After the first boot, it creates a cache which we
do mount to the host. This means that on a config change or
update/upgrade of ODL the cache will not be removed, but the files will
be. This causes ODL to fail to start.

The solution is to stop the container in update/upgrade and then remove
the cache before the update happens. This will trigger the new ODL to
rebuild the cache with the new ODL version.  For config change, we also
need to remove the cache in the host_prep_tasks so that we do not end up
in a similar state.

Closes-Bug: 1775919

Change-Id: Ia457b90b765617822e9adbf07485c9ea1fe179e5
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/20/573720/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: stop previous ODL container docker_container: name: opendaylight_api state: stopped - name: remove data, journal and snapshots when: step|int == 0 - name: Stop ODL container and remove cache block: - name: Stop previous ODL container docker_container: name: opendaylight_api state: stopped - name: Delete cache folder file: path: /var/lib/opendaylight/data/cache state: absent when: - step|int == 0 - odl_update_level == 1
deleted_lines: - name: remove data, journal and snapshots

commit_message:
vars: Do not install devel packages by default

There is no good reason why we need to install devel packages in the
containers or the host. If devel packages are required to build pip
packages then the individual roles should pull them in instead. Dropping
these packages makes the containers slightly smaller and also drops the
time it takes to bootstrap them.

Change-Id: I813b4800dd3ce22f5f5d7d7cd0ac4fce5661b1e3

Help folks that need to migrate their use of the neutron CLI for
neutron-dynamic-routing commands.

commit_message:
Replace localhost stat with file tests

Tests against localhost to check if a file exists or is of a certain
can be used directly in task conditionals, removing the need for a
separate task to register that information.

Change-Id: I3807fa9284a08708211735604e6f758db27b0a5d

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We can't set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36 due to https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/issues/425

Change-Id: I27cdedcdd7d499da545444174efb06a0f5b3948e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer-powervm refs/changes/16/573716/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
Docs: Add requirements authority module to documentation

This patchset includes documentation on the rbac_authority
and the requirements_authority modules. In addition,
the documentation for the policy_authority module is
expanded. All 3 modules are explained together, explaining
that the rbac_authority module contains an abstract
class consumed by the classes in the other two modules.

The use cases for each validation approach is also included
in the documentation.

Finally, some documentation syntax issues are corrected.

Change-Id: I33bbe2da67683faafd0749b687b99237ac815009
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/59/571559/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Using the :class:`~patrole_tempest_plugin.policy_authority.PolicyAuthority` class, policy verification is performed by:When to use ----------- This :class:`~patrole_tempest_plugin.rbac_authority.RbacAuthority` class can be used to validate the default OpenStack policy configuration. It is recommended that this approach be used for RBAC validation for clouds that use little to no policy customizations or overrides. This approach is also useful for validating the out-of-the-box OpenStack policy configuration, against which Patrole gates via Zuul. :undoc-members:
deleted_lines: Using the Policy Authority Module, policy verification is performed by: :special-members:

commit_message:
Fix response code on snapshot manage/unmanage APIs

Snapshot manage/unmanage APIs are using the HTTPUnprocessableEntity
exception (error 422), but according to the guidelines, this should not
be used. This patch changes them to HTTPBadRequest.

APIImpact
Closes-bug: #1606670
Change-Id: I124a569938d1ca06ce5234c7d0bf26ffbad60e73

commit_message:
[Tempest] Run tempest with the only plugin - manila's

Manila CI jobs have been broken several times by incompatibility with
Tempest plugins of other projects.
So, to avoid it in future, run Manila tests from Tempest's venv where
sitepackages are disabled.

Change-Id: If3d466ee0877a1bc8cdecff616a3061c40977169

commit_message:
PoC Data Service API

This patch adds a Data Service API that allows users to perform data
operations on shares such as data copy from a share to another
share and erase data from a share.

TODO:
- Unit tests
- Tempest tests
- Reno

Implements: blueprint data-service-api
Change-Id: I1014520abef2572fe10cf1534349bcc00ed4b2a0

commit_message:
Fix logging error on ensure_share

ensure_share is not a required feature for manila drivers, but when a
NotImplementedError exception is thrown by the driver, it is currently
being logged as an error. This patch fixes that by skipping this log
if the exception is a NotImplementedError.

Change-Id: I754071ccf4084095bfeec2e4c60cb984ae2f6d4a
Closes-bug: #1594461

commit_message:
Implement extend and shrink features for glusterfs

* create _resize_share() function to change volume quota
* create _get_df_data() function to get volume quota
* implement extend_share() function on _resize_share() function
* implement shrink_share() function on _resize_share() function

Change-Id: I3f69c4ac66900409ec8bf20ea207f782c1b73a29
Implements: blueprint resize-glusterfs-share

subject: Driver Data Service Helper
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-22 13:51:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/e51bce9f3acd888442baa4ce81baae4fa1c49653', 'message': 'Add Driver Data Service Helper

This change adds a helper class to allow drivers to submit
data copy and data deletion requests to the Data Service.

This change is laying ground so driver maintainers can implement
their new features on top of this and provide feedback on necessary
changes.

To use the helper, drivers need to get it from kwargs. When
invoking a helper method such as data copy or delete, it may
supply a function name for an existing function in the driver
to be invoked upon operation completion.

TODO: Unit tests.

Change-Id: I487216ed473ddcd7c4df0505e18b850c196f36f9
Implements: blueprint driver-data-service-helper

commit_message:
Driver Data Service Helper

This change is a Proof of Concept that adds a helper class to allow
drivers to submit data copy and data deletion requests to the Data
Service.

This change is laying ground so driver maintainers can implement
their new features on top of this and provide feedback on necessary
changes.

To use the helper, drivers need to get it from kwargs.

This change depends on Id32f0f0103e2ec69968e3282747a609bb50b8ebf.

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint driver-data-service-helper
Change-Id: I487216ed473ddcd7c4df0505e18b850c196f36f9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/36/295836/20 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 1.1 - Add copy_share_data(), delete_share_data() self.client = rpc.get_client(target, version_cap='1.1') def copy_share_data( self, context, src_share_id, dest_share_id, src_path, dest_path, src_share_instance_id, dest_share_instance_id, migration_info_src, migration_info_dest, callback): call_context = self.client.prepare(version='1.1') call_context.cast( context, 'copy_share_data', src_share_id=src_share_id, dest_share_id=dest_share_id, src_path=src_path, dest_path=dest_path, src_share_instance_id=src_share_instance_id, dest_share_instance_id=dest_share_instance_id, migration_info_src=migration_info_src, migration_info_dest=migration_info_dest, callback=callback) def delete_share_data( self, context, share_id, path, share_instance_id, migration_info, callback): call_context = self.client.prepare(version='1.1') call_context.cast( context, 'delete_share_data', share_id=share_id, path=path, share_instance_id=share_instance_id, migration_info=migration_info, callback=callback)

commit_message:
Base Data Copy changes

This change introduces compatibility to both Driver Data Service
Helper and Data Service API. Both features rely on the same
common code, thus it is included in this change.

This change is also dependent on the latest Share Migration code.

Partially implements: blueprint driver-data-service-helper
Change-Id: Id32f0f0103e2ec69968e3282747a609bb50b8ebf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/74/329174/24 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 1.1 - Add copy_share_data(), delete_share_data() self.client = rpc.get_client(target, version_cap='1.1') def copy_share_data( self, context, src_share_id, dest_share_id, src_path, dest_path, src_share_instance_id, dest_share_instance_id, migration_info_src, migration_info_dest, force_copy): call_context = self.client.prepare(version='1.1') call_context.cast( context, 'copy_share_data', src_share_id=src_share_id, dest_share_id=dest_share_id, src_path=src_path, dest_path=dest_path, src_share_instance_id=src_share_instance_id, dest_share_instance_id=dest_share_instance_id, migration_info_src=migration_info_src, migration_info_dest=migration_info_dest, force_copy=force_copy) def delete_share_data( self, context, share_id, path, share_instance_id, migration_info): call_context = self.client.prepare(version='1.1') call_context.cast( context, 'delete_share_data', share_id=share_id, path=path, share_instance_id=share_instance_id, migration_info=migration_info)

commit_message:
Fix issue with old opts in neutron client

Some options like api_insecure will be just ignored.
For this case kauth1 does have a special deprecated_opts
parameter which can be used. Client nova and cinder do
already map the opts manually.

Change-Id: Ie9e61786df1341dc98527c0b1498e508e64102bf
Closes-bug: #1591877

commit_message:
Do not allow to active two clean-up methods simultaneously

Activating periodic share clean-up (automatic_share_server_cleanup) and
delete_share_server_with_last_share causes race conditions.

Change-Id: I35d20d016ac9617b32ea136d0dd59d00901cb259
Closes-bug: #1587835
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/00/324300/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _set_delete_share_server_with_last_share(self, manager): def clean_up_field(manager): manager.CONF.delete_share_server_with_last_share = False manager.CONF.delete_share_server_with_last_share = True self.addCleanup(clean_up_field, manager) self._set_delete_share_server_with_last_share(manager) self._set_delete_share_server_with_last_share(manager) self._set_delete_share_server_with_last_share(manager) def test_verify_no_automtic_and_delete_share_opt_same_time(self): self._set_delete_share_server_with_last_share(manager) self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidParameterValue, manager.ShareManager)

subject: Changes to allow manila-test-image to work with scenario tests
revisions:

commit_message:
Changes to allow manila-test-image to work with scenario tests

Make mount commands configurable.

Change-Id: I3c2b0decd866024092ad3d3925847445f682cd43

added_lines: self.keypair = self.create_keypair() output = ssh_client.exec_command("ls -lRA /mnt") cmd = CONF.share.client_vm_nfs_mount_command cmd = cmd.replace('{DEVICE}', '"%s"' % location) cmd = cmd.replace('{DIR}', target_dir) LOG.debug("SSH command: %s", cmd) output = ssh_client.exec_command(cmd) LOG.debug("SSH output: %s", output) cmd = CONF.share.client_vm_cifs_mount_command cmd = cmd.replace('{DEVICE}', '"%s"' % location) cmd = cmd.replace('{DIR}', target_dir) LOG.debug("SSH command: %s", cmd) output = ssh_client.exec_command(cmd) LOG.debug("SSH output: %s", output)

subject: [WiP] Check share-network uuids in api call
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-24 12:27:55.000000000', 'files': ['manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/base.py', 'manila/tests/api/v1/test_share_networks.py', 'manila/api/v1/share_networks.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/0d3bf3d2f17d460dd843e800ddb3cf9982f5b3ae', 'message': '[WiP] Check share-network uuids in api call

A very common mistake in manila is adding a wrong uuid in the
share-network-create command. The current outcome is that
manila accepts the creation of the share-network but the share creation
fails with an error message on the server side.

When the user specifies a "neutron-net-id" (or subnet or nova-net) the

Change-Id: I403fcafa0c31b3f27c760c221c471485999d4a4e
'}]
commit_message:
[WiP] Check share-network uuids in api call

A very common mistake in manila is adding a wrong uuid in the
share-network-create command. The current outcome is that
manila accepts the creation of the share-network but the share creation
fails with an error message on the server side.

When the user specifies a "neutron-net-id" (or subnet or nova-net) the
input should be validated.

Closes-bug: #1583048

Change-Id: I403fcafa0c31b3f27c760c221c471485999d4a4e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/09/320409/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from manila.compute import nova as nova_api import manila.contextfrom manila.network.neutron import api as neutron_api self.neutron_client = None self.nova_client = None def _verify_network_uuids(self, values): if 'neutron_net_id' in values: net = values['neutron_net_id'] details = None if not self.neutron_client: self.neutron_client = neutron_api.API() try: details = self.neutron_client.get_network(net) except Exception: msg = _("Neutron network (%s) does not exist.") % net raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg) if 'neutron_subnet_id' in values and details: subnet = values['neutron_subnet_id'] if subnet not in details['subnets']: msg = _("Neutron subnet (%(subnet)s) does not exist or is " "not assigned to given network (%(net)s).") % dict( subnet=subnet, net=net) raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg) if 'nova_net_id' in values: net = values['nova_net_id'] if not self.nova_client: self.nova_api = nova_api.API() try: self.nova_api.network_get(manila.context.get_admin_context(), net) except Exception: msg = _("Nova network (%s) does not exist.") % net raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=msg) self._verify_network_uuids(update_values) self._verify_network_uuids(values)

subject: [Tempest] Try delete resources in cleanup only once
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-15 10:05:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/0d96995a879df54c390a747f4b8b62a1ff0a1e10', 'message': "[Tempest] Try delete resources in cleanup only once

Currently each tempest test of single class has in its own
cleanup queue resources of other tests. If some resource fails
to be deleted then all cleanups of subsequent tests fail too.

Therefore, rewrite cleanup logic in base test class to start using
'addCleanup' bound method for single-test-related resources.
It will make all resources be cleaned up only once.

Change-Id: Ibb44827c87eb6944defa15eb4bcb0e5544f76e7e
Closes-Bug: #1569544

commit_message:
[Tempest] Try delete resources in cleanup only once

Currently each tempest test of single class has in its own
cleanup queue resources of other tests. If some resource fails
to be deleted then all cleanups of subsequent tests fail too.

Therefore, rewrite cleanup logic in base test class to start using
'addCleanup' bound method for single-test-related resources.
It will make all resources be cleaned up only once.

Change-Id: Ibb44827c87eb6944defa15eb4bcb0e5544f76e7e
Closes-Bug: #1569544

commit_message:
Temporarily disable Ansible SSH ControlMaster during step 1

Since the sshd service is managed by puppet on the host during step 1,
the service will often need to be restarted. When it's restarted, this
can cause connection hangs and interruptions from the ansible control
node side. Temporarily disabling ControlMaster during the host
configuration of step 1 to workaround this issue.

Change-Id: I73b4bc2389099eb8881c100be9b9ec97180676d0
Partial-Bug: #1773837
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/68/573368/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # During step 1, sshd is configured by Puppet and restarted on the managed # nodes. The service restart can cause Ansible ssh to hang due to using # ControlMaster=auto. Temporarily disable ControlMaster and ControlPath # during step 1. - name: Disable SSH ControlMaster set_fact: ansible_ssh_extra_args: "-o ControlMaster=no -o ControlPath=/tmp" when: (step|int) == 1 - name: Re-enable SSH ControlMaster set_fact: ansible_ssh_extra_args: "" when: (step|int) == 1

- The private key must be converted to PKCS-1 in order to work
  properly with Galera.
- The MySQL client configuration is missing the settings that
  include the SSL certificates.
- Hard-coding the cipher causes problems for older clients,
  so we instead enable SSL and let the client and server
  negociate the ideal cipher.

logging from the SSL job because we have ARA to gather all

Change-Id: I27218c4086a50d238082895092fb8aa5e7fad807

commit_message:
Fix SSL support

The problems at the moment with setting up SSL support with
Galera are:

- The keys are not used when creating users in the mysql_user
  Ansible module
- The private key must be converted to PKCS-1 in order to work
  properly with Galera.
- The MySQL client configuration is missing the settings that
  include the SSL certificates.
- Hard-coding the cipher causes problems for older clients,
  so we instead enable SSL and let the client and server
  negociate the ideal cipher.

This patch cleans up all of those issues, removes verbose
logging from the SSL job because we have ARA to gather all
the information we need and adds jobs for all the deployment
platforms that we support.

Change-Id: I27218c4086a50d238082895092fb8aa5e7fad807

commit_message:
Update tunnel_types config option help msg

OVS agent supports gre, vxlan and geneve tunnels.
Geneve was missing in tunnel_types help description.
This patch adds it there.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: If3bd4b7ba2b56617441a34372673a215616e40ec

added_lines: "(gre, vxlan and/or geneve).")),

subject: glusterfs-native: use Heketi layout via self-signing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-18 23:46:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/66a250817bd9406a076d90f59772958a27aacc25', 'message': 'glusterfs-native: use Heketi layout via self-signing

The certificate setup that needed by the GlusterFS
native driver is not managed by Heketi. So the
GlusterFS setup provided by pure Heketi is
insatisfactory for GlusterFS native.

Howver, if the driver takes up the role of the
certificate authority (CA) and it generates, signs and
deploys certificates for the nodes involved in the
Heketi configuration, the requirements can be met.

Partially implements bp smart-glusterfs-management-with-heketi

commit_message:
glusterfs-native: use Heketi layout via self-signing

The certificate setup that needed by the GlusterFS
native driver is not managed by Heketi. So the
GlusterFS setup provided by pure Heketi is
insatisfactory for GlusterFS native.

Howver, if the driver takes up the role of the
certificate authority (CA) and it generates, signs and
deploys certificates for the nodes involved in the
Heketi configuration, the requirements can be met.

Partially implements bp smart-glusterfs-management-with-heketi

Change-Id: I7d0306c2c6ecd7823e49c1ba58819ce28f2eb100

commit_message:
glusterfs: heketi: Add support for JWT Auth

Heketi features a JWT (RFC 7519) based authorization mechanism.
This patch allows us to use Heketi setups where this feature
is enabled (which would be the case with real life setups).

Partially implements bp smart-glusterfs-management-with-heketi

Change-Id: I6e115ea24bfedc13ca72aae545618b4ceb027920
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/86/280486/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import datetime import hashlibimport jwtdef jwt_token(method, path, key, issuer="admin", delta={'minutes': 5}): method = method.upper() path = re.sub("\A/+", "/", "/" + path) claims = {} # Issuer claims['iss'] = issuer # Issued at time claims['iat'] = datetime.datetime.utcnow() # Expiration time claims['exp'] = datetime.datetime.utcnow() \ + datetime.timedelta(**delta) # URI tampering protection claims['qsh'] = hashlib.sha256(method + '&' + path).hexdigest() return jwt.encode(claims, key, algorithm='HS256') def __init__(self, host, requests_like=requests, jwt_key=None): self.__jwt_key__ = jwt_key if self.__jwt_key__: token = jwt_token(attr, path, self.__jwt_key__) kw['headers'] = {"Authorization": "bearer %s" % token} def __init__(self, host, requests_like=None, **kwargs): self.client = HeketiClient(host, requests_like=requests_like, **kwargs)
deleted_lines: def __init__(self, host, requests_like=requests): def __init__(self, host, requests_like=None): self.client = HeketiClient(host, requests_like=requests_like)

subject: glusterfs: introducing Heketi layout
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-11 14:10:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/8537f13861251eec1f23099bd9b17db8a9f9c620', 'message': "glusterfs: introducing Heketi layout

Heketi (http://github.com/heketi/heketi) is a high level
GlusterFS management service that offers a REST API which
allows a much smoother integration of GlusterFS as a cloud
component than direct GlusterFS interaction.

This commit is adding new a glusterfs layout that utilizes
Heketi. The mapping of entities between Manila and GlusterFS
is the same as with the volume layout, ie. a Manila share
shall be backed by a whole GlusterFS volume. However,
instead of relying on a pre-prepared volume pool as with
volume layout, Heketi lets us to create volumes on an
on-demand base. Also, the code can be much simpler, as a
Heketi setup can guarantee us a certain uniformity of the
GlusterFS deployment it manages (so for example, we don't
have to engage with a trial-and-error based guesswork to
find out whether the setup or the volume in question
supports snapshots, rather we can ask Heketi to create us a
volume that supports snapshots).

This commit enables Heketi layout for the glusterfs driver.
For glusterfs-native, some further driver/layout hooks are
needed to be able to work with Heketi, which will be
provided by a subsequent commit.

Partially implements bp heketi-client-lib

Change-Id: I1381bbfc3bea19f3dc72429a566c49b9d7e40a10

"}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2016-02-16 04:22:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/afd9daeac9b3bd04edc27ae6ccb3571c2804d8ea', 'message': "glusterfs: introducing Heketi layout

Heketi (http://github.com/heketi/heketi) is a high level
GlusterFS management service that offers a REST API which
allows a much smoother integration of GlusterFS as a cloud
component than direct GlusterFS interaction.

This commit is adding new a glusterfs layout that utilizes
Heketi. The mapping of entities between Manila and GlusterFS
is the same as with the volume layout, ie. a Manila share
shall be backed by a whole GlusterFS volume. However,
instead of relying on a pre-prepared volume pool as with
volume layout, Heketi lets us to create volumes on an
on-demand base. Also, the code can be much simpler, as a
Heketi setup can guarantee us a certain uniformity of the
GlusterFS deployment it manages (so for example, we don't
have to engage with a trial-and-error based guesswork to
find out whether the setup or the volume in question
supports snapshots, rather we can ask Heketi to create us a
volume that supports snapshots).

This commit enables Heketi layout for the glusterfs driver.
For glusterfs-native, some further driver/layout hooks are
needed to be able to work with Heketi, which will be
provided by a subsequent commit.

Partially implements bp smart-glusterfs-management-with-heketi

Change-Id: I1381bbfc3bea19f3dc72429a566c49b9d7e40a10

commit_message:
glusterfs: introducing Heketi layout

Heketi (http://github.com/heketi/heketi) is a high level
GlusterFS management service that offers a REST API which
allows a much smoother integration of GlusterFS as a cloud
component than direct GlusterFS interaction.

This commit is adding new a glusterfs layout that utilizes
Heketi. The mapping of entities between Manila and GlusterFS
is the same as with the volume layout, ie. a Manila share
shall be backed by a whole GlusterFS volume. However,
instead of relying on a pre-prepared volume pool as with
volume layout, Heketi lets us to create volumes on an
on-demand base. Also, the code can be much simpler, as a
Heketi setup can guarantee us a certain uniformity of the
GlusterFS deployment it manages (so for example, we don't
have to engage with a trial-and-error based guesswork to
find out whether the setup or the volume in question
supports snapshots, rather we can ask Heketi to create us a
volume that supports snapshots).

This commit enables Heketi layout for the glusterfs driver.
For glusterfs-native, some further driver/layout hooks are
needed to be able to work with Heketi, which will be
provided by a subsequent commit.

Partially implements bp smart-glusterfs-management-with-heketi

Change-Id: I1381bbfc3bea19f3dc72429a566c49b9d7e40a10
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/90/279090/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import manila.share.drivers.glusterfs.layout_heketi manila.share.drivers.glusterfs.layout_heketi.glusterfs_heketi_opts,

commit_message:
Fix nova_console_novnc_ssl.yml include path

This was broken since this include was moved into a subdirectory with
commit 33b24727247bf37bafe0a328d20526df6322f19c.

For all other includes moved with the above commit this was fixed in
commit 6ce3958ed49afadbff00fd7e64f7e25f91d59bda. But this include was
forgotten.

Change-Id: I3606e47f6eee25c1865b4baf735b21385e066b0d
(cherry picked from commit 45382c0e10fd762784fa0a1bd588e61be52fe3fb)

commit_message:
Add command and function to show instances

Story: #2002170
Task: #20027
Change-Id: I78991f75ea45ea61553d75301117c77a16ea8885
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/metalsmith refs/changes/25/572825/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.show([instance]) def show(self, instances): for instance in instances: _print("Node %(node)s, current state is %(state)s", node=_utils.log_node(instance.node), state=instance.state) if instance.is_deployed: ips = instance.ip_addresses() if ips: ips = '; '.join('%s=%s' % (net, ','.join(ips)) for net, ips in ips.items()) _print('* IP addresses: %(ips)s', ips=ips) def show(self, instances): """Output instance statuses.""" json.dump({instance.name: instance.to_dict() for instance in instances}, sys.stdout)
deleted_lines: _print("Node %(node)s, current state is %(state)s", node=_utils.log_node(instance.node), state=instance.state) if instance.is_deployed: ips = instance.ip_addresses() if ips: ips = '; '.join('%s=%s' % (net, ','.join(ips)) for net, ips in ips.items()) _print('IP addresses: %(ips)s', ips=ips)

commit_message:
Fix unscheduling fail when concurrent port delete

When a network is removed from a dhcp agent, in some scenarios if the
agent releases its port concurrently, there is chance that the
unscheduling will fail due to that the target port is not found.

Catch the PortNotFound exception as an expected error under this type of
concurrent circumstance and logs it to move forward.

Closes-Bug: #1775496
Change-Id: Ib51b364f6ced0de7685c8ee07c1d292308d919f5
Signed-off-by: Kailun Qin <kailun.qin@intel.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/97/573097/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib import exceptions as n_exc try: self.update_port(context, port['id'], dict(port=port)) except n_exc.PortNotFound: LOG.warning("Port %(port)s deleted concurrently " "by agent", {'port': port['id']})

commit_message:
Switch lxc-dnsmasq to start before lxc

The current state of lxc-dnsmasq starts it after the network
subsystem is started (but not necessarily up) and it could
possibly start after lxc.  This changes things to reflect how
lxc-net upstream systemd file sets up dependencies[1].

[1]: https://github.com/lxc/lxc/blob/master/config/init/systemd/lxc-net.service.in

Change-Id: If378446333dd09e378b3acd297c58fd59ce04789

subject: Fix error in 'used' quota when creating share
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-30 00:08:42.000000000', 'files': ['manila_ui/dashboards/project/shares/__init__.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila-ui/commit/4813a504d3f65192aba681c3fe12bb5625e3f402', 'message': "Fix error in 'used' quota when creating share

The 'Create Share' button calls tenant_quota_usages() to find out if a
user has sufficient quota, disabling the button if there is insufficient
quota. However, the call tenant_quota_usages() is not indempotent,
resulting in usages showing the wrong value.

This is because usages.tally() increments 'used' by value passed to it,
instead of setting it to the value. To work around this, we set 'used'
to zero before calling tally() so that this function is idempotent.

Change-Id: I3193adc95cebb29f13afa6ebd848985495d60d83
"}]
commit_message:
Fix error in 'used' quota when creating share

The 'Create Share' button calls tenant_quota_usages() to find out if a
user has sufficient quota, disabling the button if there is insufficient
quota. However, the call tenant_quota_usages() is not indempotent,
resulting in usages showing the wrong value.

This is because usages.tally() increments 'used' by value passed to it,
instead of setting it to the value. To work around this, we set 'used'
to zero before calling tally() so that this function is idempotent.

Change-Id: I3193adc95cebb29f13afa6ebd848985495d60d83
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila-ui refs/changes/51/516151/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(jake): usages.tally() increments 'used' by value passed to it, # set 'used' to zero before calling so that this function is idempotent usages['shares']['used'] = 0 usages['share_gigabytes']['used'] = 0 usages['share_snapshots']['used'] = 0 usages['share_snapshot_gigabytes']['used'] = 0 usages['share_networks']['used'] = 0

commit_message:
Move database creation into role (keystone)

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we remove the test-vars which were duplicated from the
role, and remove the DB setup tasks as they are no longer required.

Change-Id: I2d313410fa79184f77e6f8331e27cacc498878ba
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/571774

commit_message:
Replace 'Extend Share' by 'Resize Share'

While shares can be extended and shrunk from the command line interface,
the UI only offers 'Extend Share'. Rather than adding 'Shrink Share' in
addition, this patch proposes to replace 'Extend Share' by 'Resize Share'
for a better user experience. The new option allows to increase as well
as decrease the size of a share from the same panel.

Change-Id: Iaada1d81c394ad4dd3b26a4df0eb8a4f70762b6b
Closes-Bug: #1642627

commit_message:
Fix typo with Manila upgrade template

There was a typo in the update_tasks for Manila which was causing
updates and upgrades to fail. This patch fixes the typo.

Closes-Bug: 1775667

Change-Id: I88dd16fa94111a4eb56aeaa32b560cf7d12b9f82
(cherry picked from commit 5e3d90f851230c5d0489c16b68d09ddace29da8b)

commit_message:
Add granular policy rules for traits in placement

This adds the granular policy rule defaults for
traits-related APIs in the placement service. By
default these are backward-compatible and require
the admin role. They also specify the system scope
type since traits are defined and used by the system,
but scope enforcement is disabled by default in
oslo.policy.

Part of blueprint granular-placement-policy

Change-Id: I9a8af3cae34e32438df12125b9bf32ccdde3b792

commit_message:
Update the version of erlang to support rabbitmq

The version of erlang we're using, while functional, is not recommended.
This change updates our version of erlang for rabbitmq to be the
recommended version by changing the pinned version of erlang.

The apt package pinning meta dependency has been removed and put into
the apt task file as an include role. To ensure a more uniform process
for setting the version of erlang used with rabbitmq the new variable
`rabbitmq_erlang_version_spec` has been added. This option has a default
of "null" and is set by distro specific variables when applicable.

Erlang version support matrix: https://www.rabbitmq.com/which-erlang.html

Change-Id: Iced12d4533eec068bd11d8bd235d81308ef40427
(cherry picked from commit ce90c91857de4a840e5db655a3a42b5de0482ede)
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server refs/changes/87/573287/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: - role: apt_package_pinning apt_package_pinning_file_name: "rabbitmq.pref" apt_package_pinning_priority: 999 apt_pinned_packages: - package: "*" release: "Erlang Solutions Ltd." - package: "erlang*" version: "1:19.3*" priority: 1000 when: - ansible_pkg_mgr == 'apt'

subject: Avoid removing kolla-cli directories on destroy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-07 20:51:01.000000000', 'files': ['tools/cleanup-host'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/c7c61fca06414735ed0bb3e62e90a098bd16be13', 'message': 'Avoid removing kolla-cli directories on destroy

When running the kolla-ansible destroy playbook most of the files
under /etc/kolla are cleaned up.  This change will cause the
clean-up to skip the kolla-cli related directories.  When running
the deployment code in a container or a separate VM this is not
an issue, but when doing an all-in-one or running the deployment
process from one of the systems being deployed onto it would have
previously destroyed the kolla-cli inventory and any generated
certificates used for TLS.

Change-Id: Icd62e177964b8fb31052131785c6d7b138975a28
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid removing kolla-cli directories on destroy

When running the kolla-ansible destroy playbook most of the files
under /etc/kolla are cleaned up.  This change will cause the
clean-up to skip the kolla-cli related directories.  When running
the deployment code in a container or a separate VM this is not
an issue, but when doing an all-in-one or running the deployment
process from one of the systems being deployed onto it would have
previously destroyed the kolla-cli inventory and any generated
certificates used for TLS.

Change-Id: Icd62e177964b8fb31052131785c6d7b138975a28
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/36/573436/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
